Command.Name: Save Nvmem As Factory Default
Command.Description: Starts a process to copy NVMEM standard image to a NVMEM log file

Command.Name: Restore Factory Default Nvmem
Command.Description: Starts a process to restore NVMEM standard image from a previously created NVMEM log file

Command.Name: Restore Firmware Default Nvmem
Command.Description: Starts a process to restore NVMEM restorable standard image from ROM

Variable.Name: Nvmem Volume Id
Variable.Description: Volume id; 0 is always present, others project-dependent

Variable.Name: Nvmem Defaults Mask Flags
Variable.Description: Works together with Match Flags (see description); intended value is 0x04

Variable.Name: Nvmem Defaults Match Flags
Variable.Description: Works together with Mask Flags. Both 0's will restore everything. Other sensible values are for internal use. The logic is that the item is resored iff its (flags & mask) == match. The intended use is with value 0x04 (only NVMEM records designed to be restored)

Variable.Name: Nvmem Defaults Test Only
Variable.Description: 0 executes requested defaults; !=0 tests the defaults integrity
